text:
Question 90) Hunger is not a technical problem, because it is not due to the lack of food, because hunger lives today with the material conditions to solve it.
PORTO-GONÃ‡ALVES, C. W. Geography of wealth, hunger and environment. In: OLIVEIRA, A. U.; MARQUES, M. I. M. (Org.). The field in the 21st century: territory of life, struggle and justice construction The text demonstrates that the food problem presented has a political dimension because it is associated with (a)
A) Regional Productivity Scale.
B) Standard of income distribution.
C) difficulty of grain storage.
D) growth of the world population.
E) Product flow cost.
